data.text:
Attorneys

Associate Attorney Hybrid Remote/In Office (IL) in our Chicago office with a minimum of 1 year of litigation experience. With a primary focus on products liability litigation, the attorney holding this position will be responsible for managing case files, taking and defending depositions, legal research, preparing legal documents, investigating facts and attending hearings, depositions, mediations and trials. Qualified candidates must have strong academic credentials, excellent writing and research skills, and proven ability to analyze sophisticated and complex factual and legal issues. They need to be a self-starter with the ability to work independently on smaller matters, but also within a team structure on larger ones. Courtroom, motion, and deposition experience preferred. Experience in state and federal courts and with alternative dispute resolution is also desirable. This is a hybrid position, with a flexible mixture of remote and intermittent in-office attendance. Illinois bar license required. To submit your resume, please click here.

Associate Attorney Hybrid Remote/In Office – General Litigation (IL) in our Chicago office with a minimum of 3 years’ relevant legal experience. The primary focus will be on commercial litigation (contract disputes, fraud, statutory violations, and business torts), intellectual property litigation, product liability, professional liability and technology and cybersecurity matters. The attorney holding this position will be responsible for managing case files, legal research, preparing legal documents, investigating facts, and attending hearings, depositions, mediations, and trials. Qualified candidates must have strong academic credentials, excellent writing and research skills, and proven ability to analyze sophisticated and complex factual and legal issues. They need to be a self-starter with the ability to work independently on smaller matters, but also within a team structure on larger ones. Courtroom, motion, and deposition experience required, and trial experience preferred. Experience in state and federal courts and with alternative dispute resolution is also desirable. Illinois bar license required. Additional licenses a plus, particularly in jurisdictions where the firm maintains offices. This is a hybrid position, with a flexible mixture of remote and intermittent in-office attendance. Please submit resume, writing samples, and law school transcript. To submit your resume, please click here.

Associate Attorney Hybrid Remote/In-Office (FL) in our Ft. Lauderdale office practicing Third Party Insurance Coverage, including bad faith and extra-contractual defense on behalf of insurance companies. Candidates should have a minimum of 3 years’ relevant legal experience, Florida licensed, with experience writing coverage opinions, reservation of rights letters, responding to Florida Civil Remedy Notices, and excellent research and writing skills. Competitive salary plus comprehensive benefit package available. This is a hybrid position, with a flexible mixture of remote and intermittent in-office attendance. Candidates do not need to reside in South Florida. To submit your resume, please click here.

Associate Attorney Hybrid Remote/In-Office (FL) in our Ft. Lauderdale office practicing Equine Law, including litigation and contractual matters for clients, to include but not limit to trainer’s liability, sale/lease disputes, boarding agreements, etc. Candidates should have a minimum of 3 years’ relevant legal experience, Florida license and equestrian experience a must. Competitive salary plus comprehensive benefit package available. This is a hybrid position, with a flexible mixture of remote and intermittent in-office attendance. To submit your resume, click here.

Associate Attorney Hybrid Remote/In-Office (FL) in our Ft. Lauderdale office practicing general liability and First Party Property Insurance coverage. Candidates should have minimum two years’ experience, Florida license, excellent research and writing skills, as well as solid oral communication skills. Other state and federal court admissions a plus. Competitive salary plus comprehensive benefit package available. This is a hybrid position, with a flexible mixture of remote and intermittent in-office attendance. To submit your resume, click here.

Associate Attorney Hybrid Remote/In-Office (FL) position available for candidate based in the tri-county area (Broward/Dade/Palm Beach) practicing medical malpractice, with legal malpractice experience a plus. Candidates should have a minimum of 4 years’ relevant legal experience, Florida license and excellent research and writing skills. Competitive salary plus comprehensive benefit package available. This is a hybrid position, with a flexible mixture of remote and intermittent in-office attendance. To submit your resume, click here.

Senior Associate Attorney Hybrid Remote/In-Office (MI) in our Southfield, MI office with a minimum of 5 years’ first party PIP experience. We are seeking an experienced Michigan litigator, first or second chair trial experience a plus, in automobile negligence and premises liability cases. The attorney holding this position will be responsible for managing case files, supervising other attorneys, taking and defending depositions, legal research, preparing legal documents, investigating facts, and attending hearings, depositions, mediations and trials. This is a hybrid position, with a flexible mixture of remote and intermittent in-office attendance. Qualified candidates must have strong academic credentials, excellent writing and research skills, and proven ability to analyze sophisticated and complex factual and legal issues. Courtroom, motion, and deposition experience preferred. Experience in state and federal courts and with alternative dispute resolution is also desirable. Michigan bar license required. To submit your resume, please click here.

Associate Attorney Hybrid Remote/In-Office – Insurance Defense (MI) in our Southfield, MI office with a minimum of 2 years’ litigation experience. The primary focus will be on general insurance defense matters (premises liability, property damage, fire loss, etc.) and first- and third-party automobile negligence. The attorney holding this position will be responsible for managing case files, taking and defending depositions, legal research, preparing legal documents, investigating facts, and attending hearings, depositions, mediations and trials. This is a hybrid position, with a flexible mixture of remote and intermittent in-office attendance. Qualified candidates must have strong academic credentials, excellent writing and research skills, and proven ability to analyze sophisticated and complex factual and legal issues. They need to be a self-starter with the ability to work independently on smaller matters, but also within a team structure on larger ones. Courtroom, motion, and deposition experience preferred. Experience in state and federal courts and with alternative dispute resolution is also desirable. Michigan bar license required. To submit your resume, click here.

Associate Attorney Hybrid Remote/In-Office (PA) in our Philadelphia office general litigation practice groups, including Labor Law, premises liability, discrimination, tort/sports/hospitality matters with a minimum of 2 years of relevant legal experience. Candidates should have excellent research and writing skills, solid oral communication skills and deposition experience. PA bar admission required, with federal court admissions a plus. This is a hybrid position, with a flexible mixture of remote work and as-needed in-office attendance. To submit your resume, click here.

Associate Attorney Hybrid Remote/In-Office (PA) in our Pittsburgh office general litigation practice group, including product liability, mass tort/toxic tort, premises liability, and general commercial litigation with a minimum of 2 years’ relevant legal experience. Candidates should have excellent research and writing skills, solid oral communication skills and deposition experience. PA bar admission required, with federal court and West Virginia admissions a plus. This is a hybrid position, with a flexible mixture of remote work and as-needed in-office attendance. To submit your resume, click here.

Associate Attorney (TX) in our Austin office to support the insurance litigation team with a minimum of 1 year of relevant legal experience. This position will involve hands-on work across a range of practice areas, including first party bad faith, transportation, premises liability and other serious litigation matters. This is an excellent opportunity for attorneys looking to hone their litigation skills while receiving training and mentorship from partners with deep experience in these practice areas. We seek candidates with a current, active license to practice law in Texas, experience in civil litigation (drafting pleadings, motion practice, discovery, depositions), excellent legal, research, writing, advocacy skills and the ability to multitask and manage multiple deadlines. To submit your resume, please click here.

Paraprofessionals

Paralegal (MI) in our Southfield, MI office. This position will be assisting primarily with premises liability and 3rd party auto negligence cases. The Paralegal will be responsible for preparing legal documents, research, manage calendar, and assist attorneys with preparation for hearings, depositions and trials. To submit your resume, please click here.

Professional Staff

Legal Assistant (FL) legal administrative support needed for our Ft. Lauderdale office with a minimum of 3 years’ first party insurance defense experience necessary. The candidate must have experience with Florida State & Federal courts filings and procedures, additional experience with other venues a plus. Candidates must have a strong attention to detail, excellent organizational and communication skills. The firm offers comprehensive benefits, competitive salaries, and excellent work environment. This is a hybrid position, with flexible mixture of remote and intermittent in-office attendance. To submit your resume, please click here.
